intro: Disa sabulosa, commonly known as the sand disa, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its grass-like foliage and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and bloom in late summer to early autumn. Disa sabulosa is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively easy to grow in well-drained conditions.
